Pecah Kongsi Lagi, Begini Kisruh Garuda Indonesia-Sriwijaya Air
07 Nov 2019, 23:45 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Kukuh S. Wibowo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta-Perusahaan maskapai penerbangan Garuda Indonesia dan Sriwijaya Air kembali pecah kongsi. Direktur Teknik dan Layanan Garuda Iwan Joeniarto menginformasikan bahwa Sriwijaya Air tidak lagi tergabung dengan Garuda Indonesia Group.
"Dengan berat hati, kami menginformasikan bahwa Sriwijaya melanjutkan bisnisnya sendiri,‚Äù kata Iwan Joeniarto dalam keterangan tertulis pada Kamis, 7 November 2019.
Adanya pemberitahuan ini sekaligus menandai bahwa hubungan Sriwijaya Group dan Garuda Indonesia Group, yang sebelumnya berstatus kerja sama manajemen atau KSM, kembali menjadi business to business (B to B). Buyarnya hubungan Sriwijaya dan maskapai pelat merah ini bukan yang pertama kali terjadi. Pada September lalu, kerja sama keduanya sudah lebih dulu retak. Namun, sempat rujuk.
Dihimpun Tempo, berikut ini lika-liku retaknya hubungan Garuda Indonesia Group dan Sriwijaya Air Group.

Oktober 2018, Sriwijaya Air melaporkan beban utang perusahaan kepada BUMN yang membengkak. Utang mereka kepada PT Pertamina (Persero) Rp 942 miliar, PT GMF AeroAsia Tbk Rp 810 miliar, PT Bank Negara Indonesia Rp 585 miliar, PT Angkasa Pura II (Persero) Rp 80 miliar, PT Angkasa Pura I (Persero) Rp 50 miliar. Total utang manajemen Sriwijaya Air kala itu disebut tiga kali lipat lebih banyak dari aset.
November 2018, Sriwijaya Air dan Garuda Indonesia Group meneken kerja sama operasi atau KSO, yang selanjutnya berubah menjdi kerja sama manajemen atau KSM. Garuda Indonesia Group mengirim perwakilannya untuk menempati beberapa kursi strategis di Sriwijaya Air.
Desember 2018, tim Garuda Indonesia Group mencatat kas Sriwijaya Air rugi Rp 1,2 triliun.
Januari 2019, manajemen Garuda Indonesia Group mencatatkan keuntungan pengoperasian Sriwijaya Air Rp 36 miliar.
Februari 2019, Sriwijaya Air mencatatkan keuntungan Rp 17 miliar, Garuda Indonesia Group melakukan penyesuaian gaji untuk karyawan Sriwijaya Air.
Maret 2019, pemegang saham dan komisaris Sriwijaya Air menggelar rapat umum pemegang saham luar biasa atau RUPSLB tanpa pemberitahuan ke direksi. RUPSLB menghasilkan keputusan mengubah anggaran dasar rumah tangga yang isinya membatasi kewenangan direksi. Pada saat itu juga, Sriwijaya Air membukukan untung Rp 20 miliar.
Juni 2019, akta RUPBLB pada Maret keluar
Juli 2019, Komisaris Sriwijaya Air Ari Akshara dan Direktur Sriwijaya Air Julaindra Nurtjahjo mundur karena rangkap jabatan di Garuda Indonesia Group.
Agustus 2019, pemegang saham mengangkat Jenderal (Purn) Jusuf Manggabarani sebagai komisaris utama dan RA Tampubolon sebagai Direktur Legal dan Kepatuhan. Sriwijaya Air juga mengangkat pelaksana tugas dan harian sehingga terjadi dualisme kepemimpinan. Saat itu, Garuda Indonesia Group menyatakan keberatan.
24 September 2019, GMF mencabut lima mesin di pesawat Sriwijaya Air.
25 September 2019, Direktur Utama Sriwijaya Air Joseph Saul mundur karena ada dualisme kepemimpinan. Kemenhub mengangkat Jefferson I Jauwena sebagai key person. Ia menjadi Plt Dirut Sriwijaya Air. Berbarengan dengan itu, Garuda Indonesia Group mencabut semua logonya di pesawat Sriwijaya Air dan Nam Air.
29 September 2019, Direktur Quality, Safety, dan Security PT Sriwijaya Air Toto Soebandoro menyurati pemegang saham untuk menghentikan pengoperasian sementara pesawat Sriwijaya karena tidak layak terbang.
30 September 2019, dua direktur Sriwijaya Air mengundurkan diri karena surat soal keamanan operasional armada tidak digubris. Bersamaan dengan itu, pemegang saham Sriwijaya Air dan Garuda Indonesia rapat dengan Kementerian Perhubungan dan Kementerian BUMN.
1 Oktober 2019, Sriwijaya Air Group dan Garuda Indonesia Group rujuk.

7 November 2019, Garuda Indonesia Group dan Sriwijaya Air Group pecah kongsi lagi. Maskapai pelat merah memberikan keterangan tertulis bahwa Sriwijaya Air telah memutuskan tidak lagi tergabung dengan manajemennya.
FRANCISCA CHRISTY ROSANA | MAJALAH TEMPO | Sumber: Wawancara

Broken Share Again, This Is Like a Chaotic Garuda Indonesia-Sriwijaya Air
07 Nov 2019, 23:45 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Kukuh S. Wibowo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Garuda Indonesia and Sriwijaya Air airline companies have again broken up in partnership. Garuda Technical and Service Director Iwan Joeniarto informed that Sriwijaya Air is no longer affiliated with the Garuda Indonesia Group.
"With a heavy heart, we inform that Sriwijaya continues its own business," Iwan Joeniarto said in a written statement on Thursday, November 7, 2019.
The existence of this notification also marked that the relationship between Sriwijaya Group and Garuda Indonesia Group, which previously had the status of management cooperation or KSM, returned to business to business (B to B). The collapse of Sriwijaya's relationship with the state-owned airline is not the first time this has happened. Last September, the cooperation between the two had already cracked. However, had reconciled.
In Tempo, here are the twists and turns of the broken relationship between Garuda Indonesia Group and Sriwijaya Air Group.

October 2018, Sriwijaya Air reports the company's debt burden to the swelling SOEs. Their debts to PT Pertamina (Persero) Rp 942 billion, PT GMF AeroAsia Tbk Rp 810 billion, PT Bank Negara Indonesia Rp 585 billion, PT Angkasa Pura II (Persero) Rp 80 billion, PT Angkasa Pura I (Persero) Rp 50 billion. Sriwijaya Air's total debt management at that time was said to be three times more than assets.
November 2018, Sriwijaya Air and Garuda Indonesia Group sign an operation cooperation or KSO, which subsequently changes to a management cooperation or CBO. Garuda Indonesia Group sent its representatives to occupy several strategic seats in Sriwijaya Air.
December 2018, the Garuda Indonesia Group team recorded Sriwijaya Air's cash loss of Rp 1.2 trillion.
In January 2019, the management of Garuda Indonesia Group recorded a profit of operating Sriwijaya Air of Rp 36 billion.
February 2019, Sriwijaya Air recorded a profit of Rp 17 billion, Garuda Indonesia Group made a salary adjustment for Sriwijaya Air's employees.
In March 2019, Sriwijaya Air's shareholders and commissioners held an extraordinary general meeting of shareholders or EGMS without notice to the directors. The EGMS resulted in a decision to change the statutes of the household whose contents limited the authority of the directors. At that time, Sriwijaya Air booked a profit of Rp 20 billion.
June 2019, the deed of RUPBLB in March is issued
July 2019, Sriwijaya Air Commissioner Ari Akshara and Sriwijaya Air Director Julaindra Nurtjahjo resigned because of a dual position at the Garuda Indonesia Group.
August 2019, shareholders appoint General (Ret.) Jusuf Mangg Stephani as president commissioner and RA Tampubolon as Director of Legal and Compliance. Sriwijaya Air also appointed executors of tasks and dailies so that leadership dualism occurred. At that time, the Garuda Indonesia Group objected.
September 24, 2019, GMF revoked five engines on Sriwijaya Air aircraft.
September 25, 2019, Sriwijaya Air Managing Director Joseph Saul resigned because of leadership dualism. The Ministry of Transportation appointed Jefferson I Jauwena as the key person. He became Acting Director of Sriwijaya Air. At the same time, Garuda Indonesia Group revoked all of its logos on Sriwijaya Air and Nam Air planes.
29 September 2019, PT Sriwijaya Air's Director of Quality, Safety and Security Toto Soebandoro sent a letter to shareholders to temporarily stop operating Sriwijaya aircraft because they were not fit to fly.
September 30, 2019, two directors of Sriwijaya Air resigned because a letter regarding the security of the operational of the fleet was ignored. At the same time, shareholders of Sriwijaya Air and Garuda Indonesia met with the Ministry of Transportation and the Ministry of BUMN.
October 1, 2019, Sriwijaya Air Group and Garuda Indonesia Group reconcile.

November 7, 2019, Garuda Indonesia Group and Sriwijaya Air Group broke up another partnership. The state-owned airline provides written statement that Sriwijaya Air has decided to no longer join its management.
FRANCISCA CHRISTY ROSANA | MAGAZINE TEMPO | Source: Interview
